intro: Anamaria heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf anamaria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, ranging from elliptical to ovate, and its showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
